title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Friday 9 March - BBC News
summary: racist chants at university : three released by police .
murder victim 's mother backs knife crime campaign .
homes still without water in buxton and ashbourne .

documents.title: nottingham forest 0-0 derby county
text: nottingham forest 0-0 derby county
author: Owen Phillips
BBC Sport

documents.title: west bromwich albion 1-4 leicester city
text: west bromwich albion 1-4 leicester city
author: Timothy Abraham
BBC Sport

documents.title: ex-miners told they owed thousands in tax
text: ex-miners told they owed thousands in tax

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for east midlands live for another week , we 'll be back with all the news , sport , travel and weather from 8:00 on monday .
have a nice weekend and mother 's day
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: weather outlook for the region
text: a cloudy night to come and milder than of late with patchy rain and drizzle initially this evening , turning heavier and more persistent through the early hours .
winds will also strengthen into the early hours of saturday .
temperatures are expected to range between 4 and 8°c ( 39 to 46°f ) .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: injury concerns for derby county ahead of forest clash
text: the rams could be without five of their key players during sunday 's east midlands derby with nottingham forest .

joe ledley and george thorne will not be making the trip to the city ground with further issues concerning camerone jerome , tom huddlestone and david nugent , who 're all doubts , but expected to be part of the squad .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: bus driver jailed for raping schoolgirl
text: bus driver jailed for raping schoolgirl

documents.title: 'local beauty spot ' still blighted by illegal waste
text: tonnes of waste still blights a `` local beauty spot '' more than a year after it was a illegally dumped .
nottinghamshire county council said establishing who owns the land where the waste was fly-tipped in cotgrave is proving complicated and lengthy adding it `` sympathises with residents '' .
bails of waste were dumped on the site near the a46 in october 2016 but these were set alight and the rubbish spread across a wide area .
christine jeffreys , chairman of cotgrave town council , said : `` i 'm absolutely heartbroken .
i 'm also angry because the people of cotgrave , they 're good , they 're kind , they 're decent people and they really do n't deserve this .
`` this was a beauty spot where they could come and walk their dogs and the children and it 's been taken away from them . ''
it 's understood the council is still trying to establish who exactly owns the land and if they have the resources to remove the waste .
the environment agency is also investigating
author: Quentin Rayner
East Midlands Today chief news reporter

documents.title: driver jailed for killing baby daughter
text: driver jailed for killing baby daughter

documents.title: paedophile hunters 'catch 50 suspects '
text: the chief constable of nottinghamshire police has said nearly 50 suspects have been arrested in the past year as a result of the force 's work with so-called paedophile hunters .
members of the groups often post online as children , then tip-off the police who make arrests .
chief constable craig guildford said they 're providing a valuable service on top of the official channels .
`` some of these paedophile hunters can do things very quickly , off their own back , because it 's unregulated .
`` for us there are a huge number of hurdles to go through , quite rightly so we comply with the law of the land . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: cooking triggers fire alarm at high-rise building off old market square
text: a fire alarm triggered by someone cooking at a high-rise building off of nottingham 's old market square caused an evacuation .
the alarm was sounding at a building on st james 's street , just off nottingham 's old market square .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: cricket boss to sleep rough for charity
text: the chief executive of derbyshire cricket club is joining dozens of other people sleeping rough tonight .
simon storey is taking part in the ymca 's annual sleep easy event to raise money for disadvantaged young people .
a total of 115 people took part last year and the money raised helped provide accommodation for more than 300 young people in need .
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: teenager goes missing in clifton
text: police are appealing for help in finding a 15-year-old girl who 's gone missing from her home in clifton .
aliyah slack was wearing a white t-shirt and black trousers when she disappeared yesterday .
call 101 if you can help .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: on-the-run drug dealer jailed
text: a drug dealer has been jailed for five years and three months after admitting possessing cocaine and cannabis with intent to supply .
ian walters , of hucknall , had been evading arrest since his home in papplewick lane was raided in june last year , according to nottinghamshire police .
a complex investigation involving digital and financial experts took place and the 48-year-old was eventually found , arrested and charged last month .

at nottingham crown court on wednesday , walters admitted one count of possession with intent to supply cocaine and one count of possession with intent to supply cannabis and was jailed for 63 months .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: american adventure : the derelict years
text: earlier we told you about a woman from sutton who 's trying to find a new home for an american adventure log flume that currently sits in front of her late mother 's house in alfreton .
the former ilkeston theme park also shows up in this fascinating feature , looking at what remains of now-closed attractions around the uk .
camelot and american adventure might be fondly remembered but there were perhaps fewer tears shed over the demise of blobby land .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: dwp responds after athlete blasts disability assessments
text: the department for work and pensions has responded after swimmer charlotte henshaw complained on twitter that a recent assessment for disability benefits had left her feeling `` demoralised '' and `` degraded '' .
a spokesperson said : assessments work for the majority of people , with 87 % of pip claimants telling us that they 're happy with their overall experience .
`` however , our aim has to be that every single person feels they are treated fairly , with respect and dignity .
we are committed to continuously improving the experience of our claimants and we continue to work closely with our assessment providers to ensure people receive high quality assessments .
`` decisions are made after careful consideration of all the available evidence , and anyone who disagrees with a decision can appeal . ''
had my pip assessment today .
hands down one of the most degrading & demoralising experiences i 've had .
how can someone sitting behind a laptop with generic questions have any idea what daily life is like with a disability ?
my legs were still not there last time i looked
this makes me so angry that you had to face such indignity- i will continue to fight against these tory policies .
you definitely wo n't be alone in that
i represented someone at a tribunal who 's claim due to severe depression was rejected because she could touch toes & walked her dog .
i 'm not even joking .
chairman of tribunal was furious , but that did n't help the severely depressed person who 'd been without income for 7 months
wow .
that 's horrific .
so sorry that was the case .
worrying for that long must have been awful .
'like ' is n't really appropriate here .
i 'm sorry you 've had to go through that .
meaning fully understood thank you !
it infuriates me that decisions are based on such a narrow set of questions that are supposed to tell them everything they need to know .
that 's really sad to hear .
i understand they 're just following protocol but i do n't think it 's the most effective way to do things .
hope all is well now
why the hell do you need to do that ?
can not just walk in slap your non existent thigh and say cheers moron goodbye and thanks for wasting my time !
no can do , amigo !
have to prove that i 'm disabled enough to warrant motability help your way sounds preferable
what absolute dicks ! !
i had mine today , too .
i wish i could say my experience was different it was n't .
you have my empathy , ( not that it 's worth a lot ) .
i think that is the general consensus ( that i 've seen , anyway ) just awful .
hope the decision comes back positively for you and hope you 're keeping well : )
hopefully today 's experiences will have positive outcomes for both of us .
i hope all is well with you .
take care : )
this is outrageous !
process must change to ensure people with disabilities are n't discriminated against and humiliated by so called 'health care professionals ' surely there is a better way ?
# nonsensical @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid thoughts ?
entirely agree .
abundance of evidence to suggest that the pip process is a fundamentally flawed one and in need of a complete overhaul

my partner was recently diagnosed with mnd and can no longer care for herself she went for her assessment 2 weeks after her diagnosis and they awarded her the minimum pip she cant wash herself , brush her hair or make a meal and is struggling to walk .
so sorry to hear that charlotte .
mark - we hope this might be of use to your partner :
yes the tactic is to prevent payment did you know the assessor is on £ 35 an hour and they are not medically qualified personnel !
the tories hate anyone who is finding it difficult to support themselves that 's their ethos but when it comes to subsidised bars and corruption
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: leicester curry awards ' nominees announced
text: the nominations for leicester 's second ever curry awards have been announced .
more than 5,000 nominations were made for the 2018 awards , celebrating local businesses , with half of the 30 finalists being new restaurants .

this year the awards consist of six main categories including restaurant of the year , best vegetarian restaurant , best takeaway , best pub restaurant , best new restaurant and best fine dining restaurant and each received five finalists .
you can see the full list of nominees here .
author: Sophie Cook
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: police say they may never catch train station arsonist
text: two months after a fire ripped through nottingham railway station , police have admitted they are no closer to catching those responsible .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: jcb to take on hundreds of new workers
text: growing global demand is driving the creation of 600 new manufacturing jobs at jcb , the firm has said .
a third of the temporary roles at the staffordshire-based construction equipment giant will be available immediately .
the rest will be needed across the next 12 weeks for the firm 's production lines in rugeley , rocester , cheadle and foston in derbyshire .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: missing derbyshire woman found
text: police say jasmine mairs , who went missing after visiting buxton yesterday , has been found safe and well .
the force thanked everyone who shared the appeal to find the 21-year-old from fairfield .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: listen : gary rowett on rams v forest
text: derby county boss gary rowett has been talking to the media ahead of sunday 's big match at nottingham forest .
he said the game provided his side with an opportunity to reignite their season after a run of poor form .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : sleepy owl at wollaton
text: thanks to steve a for this charming owl photo , taken at wollaton park early this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: severn trent winds down emergency water operation
text: severn trent says it will stop giving out free bottles of water to customers affected by pipe bursts in ashbourne and buxton at 19:00 .
the firm has been handing out bottles at ashbourne 's shawcroft car park , sudbury hall and buxton market place over the past few days after hundreds of homes were left without water .
the company said things were now returning to normal so the free water stations would not be reopening .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: panthers legend announces retirement
text: nottingham panthers star david clarke has been speaking to bbc radio nottingham after announcing he will retire at the end of the season .
the 36-year-old joined the club in 2003 and is the elite league 's all-time leading points and goalscorer .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'vandalised ' clumber park bridge reopens
text: a bridge , which was left badly damaged after a car was believed to have been deliberately driven into it , has reopened to cyclists and pedestrians .
the repair work on the 250-year-old ornamental bridge at clumber park , discovered this weekend , will cost `` hundreds of thousands pounds '' , the national trust has said .
people have been fundraising for the work .
a post on the park 's facebook page said the response from the public had been `` phenomenal '' .
`` be in no doubt that we will not let the vandals win the day .
we are already planning how to rescue stonework from the lake , and we have had stonemasons from hardwick hall on site to support the property team , '' it said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: under-the-limit driver breaks leg
text: the limit for breath is 35 micrograms so this driver was under half the legal limit .
a52 eastbound borrowash .
even a small amount of alcohol can have a detrimental effect on driving .
driver provided a 14ųg breath sample after his car left the road .
taken to hospital with a broken leg .
afternoon .
chris from the derby telegraph .
so was the driver over the limit then ?
if so , will be arrested being hospitalised ?
thanks
the drink driving limit is 35 micrograms in 100 millilitres of breath so in this case the driver was 14 micrograms so not over the limit .
would imagine driver will be being advised but not arrested .
you should know the limit to be honest especially so if you are a driver .
should be zero tolerance !
not acceptable
that 's why is should be 0
no sympathy , shame they did n't break more
this is a prime example as to why you do n't drink and drive !
you can still be unfit to drive ( s4 ) through drink , despite the readings .
good news is that nobody was badly hurt .
seen a number of cars in fields over the past few months , even a truck .
i wonder if driverless vehicles will be just as bad .
coount himself lucky then .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: 'three racist complaints ' at uni last year
text: nottingham trent university has told me its deputy vice-chancellor has visited the student who tweeted a video of alleged racist chanting at her halls yesterday .
the university said it has offered rufaro chisango the full range of student support '' and its own investigation is continuing while working closely with the police .
two 18-year-olds , who were arrested yesterday on sus of racially aggravated public order offences , have been released while investigations continue .
an 18-year-old woman was also released after being `` questioned under caution '' in connection with the incident , which is being treated as a hate crime .
last year there were three complaints made about racist abuse at the university , which were all investigated .
in each case no disciplinary action was deemed necessary , the university said .
meanwhile , the university 's afro-carribean society has tweeted a statement saying they believe the university is doing all it can to deal with the situation .

-official statement from the acs we hope the best for rufaro in the future and we will be working closely to run events with the university and the students ' union to shed light to incidents like this , allowing more people of colour to voice their opinion and have their say
did i miss something ?
i see they have moved the victim , but it does n't really say what discipline was involved for the people who were acting in this poor manner ?
suspension and arrests were made
good !
i am glad they are being held accountable ! !
i must have missed that part .
so unfortunate in this day and age
they acted quickly because it spread like wildfire on twitter but i 'm glad something was done
exactly , the only reason .

if not they would have just brushed it under the rug like this uni @ twitterid who is n't doing anything ab their racist student because it does n't have the media widespread that the @ twitterid story has
this should 've hit twitter ! ! ! ! !
is she still attending the university ? ? ? ?
btw it 's so funny to see white racist curse and be racist at the same time .
it was so weird to read .
is that a trying to try too hard to be racist ?
yea the uni is ignoring the issue .
they tweeted the girl who posted this & told her to take it to the admin .
but then when she did , they stopped replying , deleted their comments , locked the page , and the racist deleted her insta .
i think they 're helpin her erase the evidence
well see this is america where white power is actually a law .
and that 's the bs .
i hope someone finds her thread tho since it 's on the internet when she is searching for a job .
i guess we just have to keep retweeting with her name ! ! !
yessss ! ! !
fr girl ! ! !
it 's gon na catch up and bite her in the ass eventually .
if she was smart she would just admit to it , take responsibility and just move on before this becomes large and people really start looking her way
this is disgusting & predictable .
# nwu needs to rescind their offer to hannah james & give reparations to the black student who had to receive this abuse .
no wonder the team looks like this @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
omg had n't even seen the team tf ! !
no wonder they have no prob with racism and yesss ! ! !
thats exactly what we 're trying 2 do , 2 get the school to revoke her admission ! ! !
unfortunately they 're trying to ignore it and in the meantime this girl is wiping away all the evidence
so what 's happened to the people who have forced her out of her home ?
i 'm not sure you 've actually tackled the problem , you 've just moved the innocent victim somewhere else
they 've been arrested and suspended
it sounds like you 're trying to do the right thing .
it also appears that rufaro was without support for far too long
she should not have been moved - it 's the perpetrators who are at fault so its them who should be moved .
also , by moving her you are moving her from any friends she has made .
punish the guilty not the innocent .
can you imagine the level of emotional stress this young lady has endured i hope the uni is covering both the costs of her accommodation and tuition fees !
nobody deserves to be treated this way ever pay up !
what about having the students in question arrested by police and expelled from the university ?
they 've been arrested and suspended
omfg i applied to that unit this year time to decline !
author: Giles Taylor
BBC East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: mum halves weight after park ride shock
text: mum halves weight after park ride shock

documents.title: tories lose two east midlands council seats
text: the conservatives lost a nottingham city council seat to labour in a by-election last night , following the death of a tory councillor .
cate woodward took the wollaton west ward with a majority of 243 following the death of georgina culley ( last november .
labour now has 52 of 55 city councillors , while the conservatives have two and there 's one independent .
the tories also lost the oakham south east seat on rutland county council to an independent .
adam lowe was elected with a majority of just under 100 votes after leader , conservative tony mathias , resigned in january .
these were two of five tory losses in the latest local by-elections - two to labour , one to liberal democrats and two to independent or other .
labour lost one seat but comfortably held two in addition to the two gained from conservatives .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: two hurt in six-car crash on a50
text: two people were injured in a six-car crash on the a50 westbound between toyota island and chellaston this morning .
derbyshire police said the crash , which happened at about 07:40 , involved two audis , a bmw , a fiat , a mini and a ford focus .
they added the injuries were not life threatening .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: tram tracks uncovered in st peter 's street
text: this is quite interesting - workers carrying out paving work at the top of st peter 's street in derby have uncovered some old tram tracks .
it 's several decades since trams ran through the city centre - but passers-by seemed to be enjoying getting a glimpse of derby history .
author: Nigel Cash
BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: toilet users to be charged 20p at busy derbyshire spots
text: a 20p charge is to be brought in for public toilets at six busy locations across the derbyshire dales .
the charge is being introduced for loos at matlock 's hall leys park , bakewell 's granby road , ashbourne 's shawcroft , matlock bath memorial gardens and matlock bus station .
the district council is reviewing the future of its 26 public toilets as it works to plug a funding gap .
it 's hoping to minimise closures by convincing borough and parish councils to take over the running of some in exchange for a contribution towards costs .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: paralympian 's 'degrading ' benefits assessment
text: silver and bronze medal-winning swimmer , charlotte henshaw , has taken to twitter to blast her `` demoralising '' experience having a disability benefits assessment .
henshaw , who has had both legs amputated above the knee , said she had a personal independence payment ( pip ) assessment yesterday .
the 31-year-old said : `` my legs were still not there last time i looked . ''
pip is money people can claim from the government to help with the extra costs of everyday life if they have an illness , disability or mental health condition .
the government began rolling pip out in 2013 to replace disability living allowance .

but it 's been controversial - an independent review of pip in 2017 was critical of the assessment system , after revealing 65 % of those who appealed against rejected claims saw the decision overturned by judges .
had my pip assessment today .
hands down one of the most degrading & demoralising experiences i 've had .
how can someone sitting behind a laptop with generic questions have any idea what daily life is like with a disability ?
my legs were still not there last time i looked
this makes me so angry that you had to face such indignity- i will continue to fight against these tory policies .
you definitely wo n't be alone in that
i represented someone at a tribunal who 's claim due to severe depression was rejected because she could touch toes & walked her dog .
i 'm not even joking .
chairman of tribunal was furious , but that did n't help the severely depressed person who 'd been without income for 7 months
wow .
that 's horrific .
so sorry that was the case .
worrying for that long must have been awful .
'like ' is n't really appropriate here .
i 'm sorry you 've had to go through that .
meaning fully understood thank you !
it infuriates me that decisions are based on such a narrow set of questions that are supposed to tell them everything they need to know .
that 's really sad to hear .
i understand they 're just following protocol but i do n't think it 's the most effective way to do things .
hope all is well now
why the hell do you need to do that ?
can not just walk in slap your non existent thigh and say cheers moron goodbye and thanks for wasting my time !
no can do , amigo !
have to prove that i 'm disabled enough to warrant motability help your way sounds preferable
what absolute dicks ! !
i had mine today , too .
i wish i could say my experience was different it was n't .
you have my empathy , ( not that it 's worth a lot ) .
i think that is the general consensus ( that i 've seen , anyway ) just awful .
hope the decision comes back positively for you and hope you 're keeping well : )
hopefully today 's experiences will have positive outcomes for both of us .
i hope all is well with you .
take care : )
yes the tactic is to prevent payment did you know the assessor is on £ 35 an hour and they are not medically qualified personnel !
the tories hate anyone who is finding it difficult to support themselves that 's their ethos but when it comes to subsidised bars and corruption
this is outrageous !
process must change to ensure people with disabilities are n't discriminated against and humiliated by so called 'health care professionals ' surely there is a better way ?
# nonsensical @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid thoughts ?
entirely agree .
abundance of evidence to suggest that the pip process is a fundamentally flawed one and in need of a complete overhaul
the dwp do not care about compassion or facts .
their incompetent and evil decision makers who are only obeying orders accept the retarded and biased crap from jobcentre/atos/maximus and ignore everything from claimants/medical experts
you can understand the odd mistake , but stories like this are so numerous that you ca n't help suspecting a deliberate policy to save money at the expense of those in most need .
that 's before i start on the stress involved in fighting for your rights .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : sunrise in belper
text: a lovely hazy shot of belper 's sunrise this morning .
thanks to lindafrombelper for uploading .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: man died after fight in derby city centre car park
text: a man died after he was involved in a fight in derby city centre , an inquest has heard .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: two held over racist abuse at uni released
text: two held over racist abuse at uni released

documents.title: pride park seat thrower gets suspended sentence
text: footage has been released showing a supporter throwing a seat during derby county 's home game against sheffield wednesday in october .
robert chester , 38 , of vessey road in worksop , pleaded guilty last month to assault and throwing an object at a football match .
he was handed a 12-week jail term , suspended for a year , and banned from attending football matches for three years .
warning : third party content may contain adverts .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: derby and forest get tough on 'hateful ' online comments
text: derby county and nottingham forest have teamed up to announce a zero tolerance policy towards offensive social media posts ahead of their game on sunday .

the clubs say they 're determined to clamp down on `` hate-filled '' comments that touch on subjects like the death of former forest owner nigel doughty and the killing of six children in a house fire in derby .
the two sides are due to meet at the city ground at 14:30 on sunday .
the clubs said they `` will look to impose severe sanctions on anyone found to be making comments of this nature '' .
they also said they will `` take strong action against any individual involved in any chanting inside the stadium regarding these or similar to at this game or on any other matchday '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: breakingsecond person charged with leicester murder
text: a second person has been charged with the murder of ashley johnson in leicester .
a 17-year-old boy - who can not be named because of his age - is due to appear at leicester magistrates ' court later this morning .
ashley , 24 , was found stabbed on dannett street on 24 february .
he he died on his way to hospital .
earlier this week 20-year-old roman hemmings , of swannington road , leicester , was charged with murder .
he appeared at magistrates ' court where he was remanded into custody to appear in court again at a later date .
author: Andy Trigg
BBC Radio Leicester reporter

documents.title: robin hood marathon scrapped
text: organisers of the robin hood marathon have scrapped the full marathon for 2018 .
they say the race was `` failing to meet runners ' expectations '' but the half-marathon and mini-marathon will still take place in september .

organisers sweatshop said in a statement : `` following a three-month review to the viability of the marathon it has become apparent that this element of the event is failing to meet runners ' expectations and our aspirations and is not providing the same fantastic experience that the half marathon and mini marathon does .

`` after exploring whether we can improve the second 13.1 miles of the course and runner experience for 2018 it has unfortunately not been possible and therefore the marathon will not be part of the ikano bank robin hood marathon events this year . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: young leicester filmmakers nominated
text: a group of young people from the pauline quirke academy of performing arts have been nominated for an award at the 2018 into film awards .
their short film , mystery of the wishing star , will compete in the best live action , aged 12 and under category .
the winners will be announced at a star-studded red carpet ceremony at london 's famous bfi southbank .
you can watch the video here .
author: Sophie Cook
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: new home sought for american adventure log flume
text: the american adventure theme park may be long gone but part of it lives on in a derbyshire suburb .
when the park closed in 2007 , large parts of it were auctioned off - including this log flume boat which now sits in front of a house in alfreton .
it belonged to the mother of lorraine pyke , from sutton-in-ashfield , who 's now trying to find a new home for the carbon fibre boat following her death .
she told bbc radio nottingham : `` my mum 's husband was a bit of a one for buying absolute anything he could on ebay .
`` he saw this one day , bid on it and won it - so he had to go and dig it out of a guy 's garden in ilkeston .
`` he turned it into a working fish pond and my mum absolutely adored it . ''
she continued : `` but at the minute it 's just a memorial and it 's got to go .
there are so many things people could do with it .
`` it would be nice to know it 's going somewhere where it can still be viewed and enjoyed . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: woman vanishes after buxton visit
text: police say they 're increasingly concerned for the welfare of a 21-year-old woman who went missing after visiting buxton yesterday .
jasmine mairs , from fairfield , was last seen near argos in spring gardens at about 17:00 .
she was dressed in an orange jumper and black leggings , police said .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: murder victim 's mother backs knife crime campaign
text: a nottingham woman whose son was murdered in a knife attack has made an appeal to families ahead of mother 's day .
luke moran , 25 , was fatally stabbed to death at a house party in clifton in 2011 .
his mother jane is backing a police awareness campaign , lives not knives .
which encourages parents to warn their children they 're more at risk if they carry weapons .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: multi-vehicle crash on a50
text: this could make a few people late for work this morning .
# a50 westbound between j3 ( # a514 # chellaston ) and j4 # a38 # toyotaisland # derby .
@ twitterid on scene with a multi-vehicle collision .
traffic passing in lane 1 ( of 2 ) but they advise they will need to stop traffic to clear it .
long delays ( 30+ minutes ) .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a cold , frosty start to the morning but warming up for the weekend .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: homes still without water in buxton and ashbourne
text: severn trent is continuing to give out free bottles of water to customers whose supplies are still disrupted by a number of pipe bursts caused by last week 's cold weather .
the firm said the situation had `` continued to improve '' overnight but there were still a number of homes without water in the ashbourne and buxton area .
it said its efforts to resolve the problem had been hampered by some of the valves it needed to access being buried under deep snow .
free bottles are being handed out at ashbourne 's shawcroft car park , sudbury hall and buxton market place .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: racist chants at university : three released by police
text: two men who were arrested after a video of racist slurs being shouted at nottingham trent university emerged have been released while investigations continue .
rufaro chisango tweeted the video of the abuse which apparently included `` we hate the blacks '' while locked in her room at a halls of residence earlier this week .
the two 18-year-olds were arrested yesterday on sus of racially aggravated public order offences
notts police said an 18-year-old woman was also released after being interviewed in connection with the incident , which is being treated as a hate crime .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: join us for today 's live updates
text: happy friday everyone .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather throughout the day .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
